meanings.sent1: Her veracity in reporting the news made her a trusted journalist.
meanings.sent2: The veracity of the weather forecast was confirmed by the sunny skies.
meanings.sent3: Despite his tall tales, his veracity shone through when he spoke about his family.
meanings.sent4: The veracity of the detective's deductions astounded everyone at the crime scene.
meanings.sent5: The veracity of the historical documents provided valuable insights into the past.

meanings.definition: Habitual observance of truth in speech or statement; truthfulness.
meanings.sent1: His veracity in always telling the truth earned him the nickname 'Honest Abe'.
meanings.sent2: The veracity of her promises was never in doubt among her friends.
meanings.sent3: Even in jest, his veracity never wavered, making his jokes all the more believable.
meanings.sent4: The veracity of her love for him was evident in every gesture and word.
meanings.sent5: The veracity of his character shone through in every interaction he had.
